intro: Aquilegia einseleana var. bauhini, commonly known as the Balkan columbine, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred petals that come in shades of red, purple, and blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with lobed segments and a basal rosette. It thrives in woodland and meadow habitats, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
